awd_titl_txt: Study of Interface Waves Involving Separation - an          Important New Phenomenon in Earthquake Mechanics
awd_abstract_narration: This research is to verify and understand the phenomenon of                   earthquake fault interface waves involving separation of the fault              during rupture.  Based on earlier work by Schallamach and Comninou-             Dundurs, and on laboratory fault-rupture experiments with foam                  rubber and polycarbonate-solid models, further modeling will be                 done along with finite difference calculations.  If confirmed, the              work bears on questions of low heat flow along faults, weak stress              along faults, large overthrusts, and the locking-slip pulse model               of rupture.  This research is a component of the National                       Earthquake Hazard Reduction Program.
